title: Fix for "Launch Loop"
body:
"Launch Loop" is what I've decided to name this weird bug where when the launcher loads but when you click on [LAUNCH] nothing happens.

Please note I'm running WINDOWS 10

1.) Open _My Documents_
2.) On the left panel click _This Pc_
3.) Click now on the main menu_ Local Disk C Drive _(That's where games usually auto install unless when you originally installed your league you moved it into a different drive in that case find that drive.)
4.) Open the _Riot Games_ folder
5.) Open _League of Legends_ folder
6.) Scroll down until you locate the file called _LeagueClient_ this is where my fix works, if the symbol beside that file is an "X" or when you click on the file and "Error" pops up then this WILL help you. If not I'm not entirely sure.
7.) **DELETE** the _LeagueClient_ file
8.) In the same folder, a few files down click _lol.launcher_ and it should run the client.
9.) From the client click on the [LAUNCH] button and voila!

Goodluck!

replies.body: Hello. So I had a break from LoL like 1 month and I said to myselfind that I try a game. Well I clicked LoL icon and nothing happens. I have tried your fix but basically I reinstalled the game I don't have those files. Well long story short I would be grateful if you would uptade your method of how to fix this in mind 2018. Thank you.

Ahhhhh it sounds like you were having a problem with your OS's permissions, and Windows was blocking League from running because it didn't recognize the game. Typically the steps in our [**permission guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) can help with stuff like this, but it looks like you were able to find something else that worked for you!!

No, I had tried all the previous fixes and this was the only thing that worked, I've had messages from 11 different people telling me the same thing that they tried the other fixes and this was the only working fix (I had this as a comment on another discussion and just decided to make my own)
